channel.title: Whonix KVM on a Kicksecure Host Operating System - broken connectivity
channel.description: i first have setup kicksecure for debian (host) i after have setup the kvm whonix and the gateway can't connect to tor or the workstation can't connect to the gateway i have rebooted the host and the user is in the right groups i have enabled icmp for gateway firewall and it didn't fix

item.title: Whonix KVM on a Kicksecure Host Operating System - broken connectivity
item.dc:creator: HulaHoop
item.description:
Patrick:

And I’d sent back from Kicksecure forums to here full cycle.

The Ouroboros of tech support. Still rarely happens in Unix land

Read full topic
item.source: Whonix KVM on a Kicksecure Host Operating System - broken connectivity

item.title: Whonix KVM on a Kicksecure Host Operating System - broken connectivity
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
And I’d sent back from Kicksecure forums to here full cycle.

Kicksecure doesn’t do anything that breaks Whonix KVM. That would have been known during development of Whonix-Host.

See:

Whonix – 2 Dec 21

Troubleshooting

Troubleshooting Installation and Network Issues with Whonix ™

  • Troubleshooting
  • The only thing that I might recommend in Kicksecure forums would probably be this: Try a non-Whonix KVM VM, use Generic Bug Reproduction.

Read full topic
item.source: Whonix KVM on a Kicksecure Host Operating System - broken connectivity

item.title: Whonix KVM on a Kicksecure Host Operating System - broken connectivity
item.dc:creator: kikkohiikka
item.description:
i have installed debian, after kicksecure, all the steps listed in wiki
after i have installed kvm whonix, all the steps listed in wiki
my kvm whonix is the kvm whonix listed in wiki no different steps

item.title: Whonix KVM on a Kicksecure Host Operating System - broken connectivity
item.dc:creator: kikkohiikka
item.description:
whonix-internal virbr2 and whonix-external virbr1 (10.0.2.0/24, dhcp disabled, forwarding nat) both active and autostart

default 192.168.122.0/24 autostart and active and nat

Read full topic
item.source: Whonix KVM on a Kicksecure Host Operating System - broken connectivity

item.title: Whonix KVM on a Kicksecure Host Operating System - broken connectivity
item.dc:creator: HulaHoop
item.description:
I think this topic should be posted on the kicksecure forums. Your problem implies that the virtual networking brdiges are either deactivated or not setup.

Checj if this is what’s happening under:
VMM → Edit → Connection Details → Virtual Networks

Read full topic
item.source: Whonix KVM on a Kicksecure Host Operating System - broken connectivity

item.title: Whonix KVM on a Kicksecure Host Operating System - broken connectivity
item.dc:creator: kikkohikka
item.description:
i first have setup kicksecure for debian (host)
i after have setup the kvm whonix and the gateway can’t connect to tor or the workstation can’t connect to the gateway
i have rebooted the host and the user is in the right groups
i have enabled icmp for gateway firewall and it didn’t fix
